text: Goygol is a raion (district) in northwestern Azerbaijan. It used to be named Khanlar. It was named "Goygol" after Lake Goygol on April 25, 2008.Azerbaijani Khanlar Region Re-named The capital is the city of Goygol. There are 54,000 people. The city of Goygol is the largest town, followed by Hajimelik. Important villages are: Balchili, Gushgara, Chayli, Mollajalilli, and Topalhasanli. ==References== Category:Districts of Azerbaijan
title: Goygol District
